alert.note: Alert for Lee (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 18 at 9:19PM EST until February 19 at 4:00PM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Kentucky... Kentucky River at Heidelberg affecting Lee County. ...Forecast flooding changed from Moderate to Major severity for the following rivers in Kentucky... Kentucky River near Ravenna affecting Estill County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Kentucky River at Heidelberg. * WHEN...Until tomorrow afternoon. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 PM EST Saturday the stage was 22.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:45 PM EST Saturday was 24.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late tomorrow morning and continue falling to 12.2 feet by Thursday evening. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 22.2 feet on 04/12/1944. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. The next statement will be issued 3 a.m. early Sunday morning.
